p: We are now slowly realizing that this “super-efficient”, factory-like, program is incompatible with the periodic occurrence of epidemics, a scenario many experts consider likely, whose consequences will probably be more severe because of globalization [ 5]. While economies of scale seem to favour “hospital factories”, events like the Covid-19 infection risk compromising their ability to function, and could ultimately cause large economic losses, by making it impossible to differentially modulate the provision of care when limiting human-to-human contact is necessary.
